==Japanese==
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Venomous snake}}
[[File:Indiancobra.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|毒蛇}} (''dokuja'', ''dokuhebi''): a [[cobra]], an iconic and well-known '''[[venomous]] [[snake]]'''.]]
</div>

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|どく|じゃ|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=とくじゃ'}} compound {{m|zh|毒蛇|tr=dowk zyæ|lit=poison + snake}}.  Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''dúshé'', {{etyl|yue|-}} ''duk<sup>6</sup> se<sup>4</sup>''.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|どくじゃ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|どくじゃ}}

# [[venomous]] [[snake]]
# a [[game]] [[piece]] in dai dai shogi and taikyoku shogi

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|毒蛇の口|どくじゃ の くち}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|どく|へび|yomi=j}}
Apparent shift from ''dokuja'' above, to use the [[訓読み#Japanese|kun'yomi]] of ''hebi'' for the second character.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=j|どくへび|acc=0|dev=2|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|どくへび}}

# [[venomous]] [[snake]]
